marklogic.body:
Answering my own question from a page or so downthread -- what Cincinnati has to trade is mainly bench bats, which we don't need. But the whole back end of their BP is a complete shambles; and they've got a young pitcher named Aroldis Chapman who is, at the moment, listed as #6 in their rotation, though up to now he's played mostly out of the BP. He has 69 MLB appearances, with a 6-3 W-L, 3.27 , and 1.247 WHIP. Crucially for us, he's still got one option year remaining, and isn't up for arbitration until 2015. He has a fastball (I believe that's what you call it, isn't it, when it averages 98.4 mph and has been known to hit 105? A fastball?), a deceptive slider, and a -- no foolin', now -- 92mph changeup that's nothing special but good enough to get him through an occasional Spot start.
Hey dere, Ben Cherington! You on this? Maybe we dangle Melancon, perhaps Albers, and a Player to be Named Later (who cannot be named yet, until he comes Off the DL, but his initials bear a remarkable resemblance to those of Bobby Jenks) in front of Mr. Jocketty's nose and see if he snaps at 'em?
